bullet_point: Le Maroc renforce les "protections légales" pour les "personnes aveugles" et les "malvoyants" en 2025.

prompt_messages.content:
You are an expert prompt engineer creating detailed image descriptions for AI generation.
Craft precise press photography prompts for ultra-realistic 4K vertical (9:16) editorial photographs.

KEY PRINCIPLES:
• Focus on SCENES, ACTIONS, GESTURES, ENVIRONMENTS, OBJECTS and SYMBOLIC ELEMENTS
• Prioritize visual elements directly related to the specific bullet point
• Use the article only as global context to understand the bullet point
• Create unique, distinct imagery for each bullet point
• Balance dynamic visual storytelling through scenes, actions and symbolic elements
• ABSOLUTELY NEVER INCLUDE HUMAN FACES - this is a critical requirement
• NEVER use maps as main elements - they must only appear as minor background details if at all
• People only as secondary elements (from behind, side view, at distance, no visible faces)
• Prefer real environments, landscapes, objects, and symbolic representations

STYLE SPECIFICATIONS:
• Natural color palette, moderate saturation, realistic white balance
• Depth-of-field: moderate (f/4 – f/8)
• Include camera specs (Canon EOS R5, Nikon Z9, Sony A1, etc.)
• Use quality enhancers: "highly detailed", "HDR", "4K resolution", "professional photography"

OUTPUT FORMAT:
NO_TEXT_IN_IMAGE. NO CAPTIONS. NO WORDS.

SCENE: [Relevant scene based on bullet point]

FOCAL ELEMENTS: [Key actions, objects, or symbolic elements from bullet point]

COMPOSITION: [Rule of thirds, foreground/mid-ground/background]

TECH: [Camera body], [lens], ISO [value], [aperture]

STYLE: [Documentary realism with relevant color palette]

NEGATIVE: faces, human faces, portrait photography, selfies, text, words, numbers, signage, celebrities, religious/political symbols, maps as main elements, geographic maps as focus
–ar 9:16 –quality 4k

# CONTENT FOCUS
BULLET POINT: Le Maroc renforce les "protections légales" pour les "personnes aveugles" et les "malvoyants" en 2025.
KEYWORDS: protections légales, personnes aveugles, malvoyants

ARTICLE CONTEXT:
Morocco Strengthens Legal Protections for the Blind ADVERTISEMENT Tuesday, May 20, 2025 Prayer Times International Morocco Lifestyle Login Register Home Culture Politics Society Economy Opinion Education Western Sahara Sport No Result View All Result Home Culture Politics Society Economy Opinion Education Western Sahara Sport No Result View All Result Home > Morocco > Morocco Strengthens Legal Protections for the Blind and Visually Impaired Morocco Strengthens Legal Protections for the Blind and Visually Impaired As part of SIEL 2025, legal experts and human rights advocates convene to examine Morocco’s progress in securing justice and institutional protections for vulnerable individuals with sight disabilities. byHajare El-Khaldi Apr, 24, 2025 0 0 A A A A Reset Rabat – In a symposium held on Wednesday, April 23, as part of the 30th edition of the International Book and Publishing Fair (SIEL), Morocco shed light its ongoing efforts to strengthen legal protections for the blind and visually impaired, within the justice system and in penitentiary institutions. Follow the latest news from Morocco World News Join on WhatsApp Join on Telegram Rabat – In a symposium held on Wednesday, April 23, as part of the 30th edition of the International Book and Publishing Fair (SIEL), Morocco shed light on its ongoing efforts to strengthen legal protections for the blind and visually impaired, within the justice system and in penitentiary institutions. Organized by the Alaouite Organization for the Promotion of the Blind in Morocco (OAPAM), under the presidency of Princess Lamia Essolh, the event brought together legal experts and human rights advocates and served as a platform to review the country’s progress in enacting laws and implementing institutional measures that promote equality and access to justice for individuals with visual impairments. Bilal Driouch, a magistrate with the public prosecutor’s office and head of the civil affairs monitoring unit, stressed that people wi...

# BULLET POINT ANALYSIS
1. What is the central story in THIS specific bullet point?
2. What actions or processes are described?
3. What scenes/environments would represent THIS bullet point?
4. What physical objects directly represent THIS bullet point?
5. What visual elements make THIS image distinct from other bullet points?
6. What is the emotional tone and relevant geographical setting?

# VISUAL ELEMENTS
1. What specific scenes and actions represent this bullet point? (2-3)
2. What environment is most authentic to THIS bullet point?
3. What symbols could represent abstract concepts in THIS bullet point?
4. What lighting and color palette best matches THIS bullet point's tone?

# GENERATE IMAGE PROMPT
Create a detailed press photography prompt following the output format.

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Focus EXCLUSIVELY on THIS bullet point's content
2. Make image UNIQUE from other bullet points
3. People ONLY as secondary elements (no faces)
4. Include all sections: SCENE, FOCAL ELEMENTS, COMPOSITION, TECH, STYLE, NEGATIVE
